abstract: International Committee of Red Cross temporarily suspends operations in Aden, Yemen, after gunmen storm its offices, stealing money, vehicles, laptops and other items; organization, which supports city's surgical hospital and helps provide clean drinking water, warns any halt in operations has potential to affect nearly million people.
lead_paragraph: An attack by gunmen on the Red Cross offices in Aden highlighted the city’s growing instability despite pledges by Yemen’s exiled government to restore order there.

headline.main: Red Cross Suspends Operations in Yemen Port
headline.print_headline: Red Cross Suspends Operations in Yemen Port
